Name: Statue of the scribe Heti
Description: The official Heti is seated cross-legged on a base. He holds an unrolled papyrus on his lap. His right hand once held his writing pen which is now lost.  He wears a curly wig and a knee-length kilt with a belt. The figure is very lifelike because of its face and posture, and despite the unnatural position of the feet.
